intro: Glinus denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed glinus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Glinus denticulatus is often found in moist, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
